posts.title: Multiple people shot at Brass Mill Center mall in Waterbury, police say
top_comments:
WATERBURY — Waterbury police say multiple people were shot at Brass Mill Center mall on Union Street Tuesday afternoon.

Police said law enforcement is on the scene, and urged people to avoid the area to allow emergency personnel to respond. They said more information would be released as it becomes available.

Witnesses on scene said about 45 police, fire and medical vehicles were on scene around 5:30 p.m. They saw city and state police enter the building with long rifles and K-9 units.

People were being allowed to leave the mall in groups, a witness said.

An employee at Apple Cinemas Brass Mill said the shooting happened shortly before 4:40 p.m. They said they heard dozens of gunshots from the first floor of the mall in a matter of seconds, followed by screaming.

Fahd Syed's son was working inside the mall when the shooting occurred and he saw one of the injured victims on the floor screaming for help. Syed said his son couldn't help the woman "because he didn't know if he was going to get shot himself."

Connecticut State Police said troopers also responded to the incident, but directed any inquiries to the Waterbury Police Department.

This is a developing story and will be updated as information becomes available.

Reporters Andreas Yilma and Bruno Matarazzo contributed to this story.
